cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north toward the north-central Gulf Coast, then forecast to arc northeast across the Deep South and exit off the Carolina coast late Sunday-Monday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Louisiana coast just west of the mouth of the Mississippi River

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch area extends east of Morgan City LA to the Okaloosa/Walton County line FL, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas and metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same segment of the north-central Gulf Coast (East of Morgan City LA to the Okaloosa/Walton County line FL) now under Tropical Storm Warning
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central Gulf Coast from Louisiana eastward to the western Florida Panhandle; interior track through MS, AL, GA and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: No tropical-storm-force winds expected; only breezy conditions possible as remnant low passes well south and east
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for the Chesapeake Bay
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rain showers (generally <2 in) possible early next week as the remnant low passes offshore
